TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void SqlDataSourceSelectingEventHandler(object sender, SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed SqlDataSourceSelectingEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub SqlDataSourceSelectingEventHandler(sender As Object, e As SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs)
public delegate void SqlDataSourceSelectingEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs ^ e);

Docs.param: The source of the event, the control.
A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceSelectingEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
